final_answer:
The image uses humor and satire to comment on societal perceptions of beauty. 

The scene is divided into two parts with the text "YES, BUT" at the top. The left side emphasizes the message "Beauty is Inside," adorned with decorative graphics, suggesting that true beauty comes from within. 

On the right side, however, there's a silhouette of a person applying makeup in front of a mirror. The reflection in the mirror also reads "Beauty is Inside," but humorously, the person is seen using tools to apply external beauty products. 

This juxtaposition criticizes how society often pays lip service to the idea that inner beauty is what matters while simultaneously promoting external beauty standards. The humor lies in highlighting this contradiction.
